sentences.sContent: The law would preempt stronger local rules.
sentences.sCn: 该法律将预先制止更强硬的地方性法规。

sentences.sContent: "the survival of the fittest," a slogan that virtually preempted all debate.
sentences.sCn: “适者生存”，一个几乎无可辩驳的口号。

remMethod.val: pre(预先) + empt(拿到) → 预先拿到 → 以优先权取得

words.tran: 优先购买的；先发制人的；有先买权的
优先购买；强制收购；抢先占有；取代
获优先购买权者；先取者；先发制人者

trans.tranOther: If you preempt an action, you prevent it from happening by doing something that makes it unnecessary or impossible
